security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, no command execution. Content matches stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Create Claude Code skills and configurations
content.value_statement: Building Claude Code skills requires understanding complex configuration patterns and trigger systems. This meta-skill provides comprehensive guidance for creating, configuring, and managing skills, hooks, agents, and commands with best practices and ready-to-use templates.
actual_capabilities: Create new skills with proper directory structure and SKILL.md files
Configure skill-rules.json with file triggers, prompt triggers, and exclusions
Set up enforcement types (suggest, block, warn) and priority levels
Design guardrail skills to enforce best practices
Add custom slash commands and agents to Claude Code
Debug skill activation issues and optimize trigger configuration
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly - guides through prompts only
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not provide pre-built skill templates - requires manual creation
Does not handle skill deployment or distribution workflows

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create domain-specific skills for your team with proper triggers and configuration.

use_cases.title: Configure Guardrails
use_cases.description: Set up enforcement rules and priority levels to guide AI behavior across projects.

use_cases.title: Standardize Workflows
use_cases.description: Define consistent skill patterns and configurations for your entire organization.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [purpose]. Show me the directory structure and SKILL.md template I need.

prompt_templates.title: Configure Triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: I want my skill to activate when users mention [keywords] or work on files matching [pattern]. Write the skill-rules.json configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Add Guardrail
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a guardrail skill that blocks [action] and warns users. Include enforcement type and priority settings.

prompt_templates.title: Debug Activation
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill is not activating when it should. Check my skill-rules.json configuration and suggest fixes for [specific issue].

output_examples.input: Create a new skill for frontend development with React and Next.js patterns
output: Add SKILL.md with React 19, Next.js 15, and Shadcn/ui guidelines
Configure file triggers for app/**/*.tsx and components/**/*.tsx
Add prompt triggers with keywords: component, shadcn, react, next.js

best_practices: Use progressive disclosure - keep main SKILL.md concise and move detailed guides to resources/ folder
Make trigger patterns specific to avoid over-triggering across unrelated files
Test skill activation with actual user prompts before deployment
anti_patterns: Using overly broad keywords that trigger on unrelated requests
Missing pathExclusions for test files, node_modules, and build outputs
Setting enforcement to 'block' without clear user benefits

faq.question: What is the difference between domain and guardrail skills?
faq.answer: Domain skills provide guidelines for specific areas like frontend or backend development. Guardrail skills enforce rules and prevent mistakes with block or warn enforcement.

faq.question: How do file triggers and prompt triggers work together?
faq.answer: File triggers activate skills based on file paths and content patterns. Prompt triggers activate based on user keywords and intent. Skills can use either or both.

faq.question: Can I use regex patterns in skill configuration?
faq.answer: Yes. Intent patterns and content patterns support regex for flexible matching. Use regex testers to validate patterns before deployment.

faq.question: Is my skill data stored securely?
faq.answer: Skills are local markdown files. They contain no executable code and cannot access files or networks without explicit user permission.

faq.question: Why is my skill triggering too often?
faq.answer: Keywords may be too common or path patterns too broad. Add more specific keywords, use pathExclusions, and narrow pathPatterns to reduce triggering.

faq.question: How does this compare to other skill management tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Claude Code-specific patterns. General skill frameworks may not support Claude Code's trigger system or enforcement types.
